intro: Catanthera paniculata, commonly known as the panicled catanthera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that appear in panicles, giving it its common name. Its leaves are typically ovate and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Catanthera paniculata is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and forest edges.
